page.title: 07Allfield Club, Bomere Pool.
page.content: Bomere Pool was much frequented by Mary Webb who lived on Lyth Hill and is the'Sarn Mere'of'Precious Bane'. It is a Kettle Hole and has two basins which are in parts 70'deep. It has been best known for its{water {skiing.}Six British Championships have been staged here in which famous skiers Mike Hazelwood,Andy Maple,John Battleday,and David Nations have competed.There are also facilities for {squash,tennis,clay pigeon shooting, and{scrambling. The other main facility is{fishing. There is a trout pool beside the club house,and Shomere as well as Bomere sports many different kinds of fish. Half of a pike was once found that weighed 24lbs.It's thought that it would have been 42lbs.with the tail. There is a camp site and the club house has a restaurant,lounge,and bar.
